page.title: 01Kingswood
page.content: There are large open grounds and woodland.There is one major hill called Gypsy Hill and the general relief is hilly leading up to the Dulwich Wood Escarpment in the east. College Road is privately owned.In the SE corner is the Northern half of the old Crystal Palace site now used as a caravan camp area,TV transmission mast and reservoir. New housing devlopment dominates the old High Level station site but the tunnel under the top of Sydenham Hill still exists. In the north is a post-war estate called Kingswood.The central feature is an early nineteenth century house , built and lived in by Lord Vestey.It is now a community centre and library with bar for special occasions.It has fine oak paneling and battlements surrounding the roof.It also features much ornate marble and plasterwork.
